patterns: Tell me about skiing Teton Pass
Where is Teton Pass for backcountry?
Is Teton Pass good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is Teton Pass?
What's special about Teton Pass skiing?
response:
⛷️ **Teton Pass** — Between Wilson, WY and Victor, ID

**Difficulty:** Advanced
**Why Locals Love It:**
- Easy access right from the highway
- World-renowned glade and chute skiing
- Huge variety of terrain and lines
- Popular among locals and pro skiers
- Frequent avalanche control makes awareness essential

**Gear Needed:** Avalanche transceiver (required), Probe, Shovel, Backcountry skis/splitboard, Climbing skins, Helmet, Beacon-compatible backpack

**Safety Notes:**
- Always carry a transceiver, probe, and shovel
- Teton Pass has known avalanche chutes—check the Bridger-Teton avalanche forecast
- Park responsibly and avoid blocking plows or snow removal
- Know before you go: enroll in an AIARE avalanche course
- Watch for other users: snowshoers, snowmobilers, and splitboarders

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Teton+Pass+WY)

patterns: Tell me about skiing Mt. Taylor
Where is Mt. Taylor for backcountry?
Is Mt. Taylor good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is Mt. Taylor?
What's special about Mt. Taylor skiing?
response:
⛷️ **Mt. Taylor** — Teton Canyon, Driggs, ID

**Difficulty:** Advanced/Expert
**Why Locals Love It:**
- Legendary steeps and iconic summit
- Incredible powder in the upper bowls
- Remote feel, yet trailhead is accessible
- Massive vertical potential (over 3,000 ft)
- Among the top lines in the Tetons

**Gear Needed:** Full avy gear (beacon, probe, shovel), Skis with skins or splitboard, GPS or detailed map, Helmet and snow safety tools

**Safety Notes:**
- Steep couloirs and cliffs—expert terrain only
- Avalanche risk can be extreme post-storm
- Snowmobiles not allowed—quiet terrain, human-powered only
- No rescue coverage—ski with a partner

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Mount+Taylor+Teton+Canyon+ID)

patterns: Tell me about skiing 25 Short
Where is 25 Short for backcountry?
Is 25 Short good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is 25 Short?
What's special about 25 Short skiing?
response:
⛷️ **25 Short** — Grand Teton National Park (Inner Park Loop)

**Difficulty:** Intermediate–Advanced
**Why Locals Love It:**
- Perfect intro to big terrain near GTNP
- Sunny southern aspects soften snow
- Gentler terrain compared to Glory
- Amazing views of Jackson Valley
- Often skied in laps

**Gear Needed:** Avy beacon, probe, shovel, Skis or splitboard with skins, Helmet, GPS or Gaia app, Warm layers and water

**Safety Notes:**
- Popular but still avalanche-prone
- Accessed from Death Canyon trailhead area
- Check for cornices and wind-loaded slopes
- Be cautious of fast changes in weather

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=25+Short+Trailhead+GTNP)

patterns: Tell me about skiing Albright Peak
Where is Albright Peak for backcountry?
Is Albright Peak good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is Albright Peak?
What's special about Albright Peak skiing?
response:
⛷️ **Albright Peak** — Grand Teton National Park (near Taggart Trailhead)

**Difficulty:** Advanced
**Why Locals Love It:**
- One of the most scenic summits you can ski
- Consistent pitch for over 2,000 ft
- Great views of the Cathedral Group
- Rarely crowded even on weekends
- Incredible spring skiing line

**Gear Needed:** Avy gear mandatory, Touring skis/splitboard, Crampons or ski crampons in spring, Proper touring boots

**Safety Notes:**
- Long day—start early
- Avalanche exposure on NE aspects
- No cell service in most areas
- Leave a route plan with someone

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Albright+Peak+GTNP)

patterns: Tell me about skiing Mt. Glory
Where is Mt. Glory for backcountry?
Is Mt. Glory good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is Mt. Glory?
What's special about Mt. Glory skiing?
response:
⛷️ **Mt. Glory** — Teton Pass summit

**Difficulty:** Advanced/Expert
**Why Locals Love It:**
- Fast access to high-quality descents
- Huge number of line choices
- Classic Jackson-style terrain
- Short but steep summit climb
- Locals’ training ground

**Gear Needed:** Avy beacon, shovel, probe, Helmet, skins, alpine touring gear, Ice axe in spring or firm conditions

**Safety Notes:**
- Steep bootpack—1,500 ft gain right from car
- Frequent avalanches; multiple fatalities historically
- Do not ski without proper training
- Watch downhill traffic below your line

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Mt+Glory+WY)

patterns: Tell me about skiing Oliver Canyon
Where is Oliver Canyon for backcountry?
Is Oliver Canyon good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is Oliver Canyon?
What's special about Oliver Canyon skiing?
response:
⛷️ **Oliver Canyon** — Alpine, WY

**Difficulty:** Intermediate–Advanced
**Why Locals Love It:**
- Tight chutes and great snow preservation
- Easier access compared to higher peaks
- Nice place to escape crowds
- Less technical than central Tetons
- Multiple line options from ridge

**Gear Needed:** Avy gear, Skis or board with skins, Navigation device, Warm layers for shaded canyon

**Safety Notes:**
- Canyon terrain funnels slides—use caution
- Remote location—carry inReach or sat beacon
- Great stability on cold, clear days
- Good spot for early season

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Oliver+Canyon+Alpine+WY)

patterns: Tell me about skiing Mail Cabin Creek
Where is Mail Cabin Creek for backcountry?
Is Mail Cabin Creek good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is Mail Cabin Creek?
What's special about Mail Cabin Creek skiing?
response:
⛷️ **Mail Cabin Creek** — Teton Pass west side

**Difficulty:** Intermediate–Advanced
**Why Locals Love It:**
- Lower angle terrain for safer powder turns
- Good choice during moderate avy conditions
- Well-known among guides
- Possible to lap from bottom
- Scenic western slope forests

**Gear Needed:** Avy gear, Backcountry skis/splitboard, Climbing skins, helmet, Mapping app or paper map

**Safety Notes:**
- Tree skiing with multiple terrain traps
- Watch for recent snowfall layers
- Popular but still dangerous
- Snowmobiles also use this area

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Mail+Cabin+Teton+Pass+WY)

patterns: Tell me about skiing Taylor Mountain
Where is Taylor Mountain for backcountry?
Is Taylor Mountain good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is Taylor Mountain?
What's special about Taylor Mountain skiing?
response:
⛷️ **Taylor Mountain** — West side of Teton Pass

**Difficulty:** Expert
**Why Locals Love It:**
- One of the biggest lines off Teton Pass
- Huge descents and sustained pitches
- Snow quality can be superb
- Quiet compared to Glory
- Big rewards for strong skiers

**Gear Needed:** Full avy kit, Splitboard/skis + skins, Helmet, probe, shovel, Ice axe for spring ascents

**Safety Notes:**
- Known for fatal avalanches—advanced only
- Long tour—expect 4–6 hours RT
- Exposure near summit
- Check with Bridger-Teton avalanche center

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Taylor+Mountain+WY)

patterns: Tell me about skiing South Leigh Canyon
Where is South Leigh Canyon for backcountry?
Is South Leigh Canyon good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is South Leigh Canyon?
What's special about South Leigh Canyon skiing?
response:
⛷️ **South Leigh Canyon** — Driggs, ID

**Difficulty:** Advanced
**Why Locals Love It:**
- Rarely tracked terrain with deep snow
- Alpine feel with less exposure
- Multiple faces and cirques
- Strong snow retention from storms
- Great basecamp adventure zone

**Gear Needed:** Avy gear, Navigation tools, Ski crampons in spring, Proper layering & nutrition

**Safety Notes:**
- Remote area with limited tracks
- Consider multi-day overnight camping
- Must be confident in route finding
- Deep snowpacks can obscure hazards

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=South+Leigh+Canyon+Driggs+ID)

patterns: Tell me about skiing Stateline Canyon
Where is Stateline Canyon for backcountry?
Is Stateline Canyon good for advanced skiers?
How dangerous is Stateline Canyon?
What's special about Stateline Canyon skiing?
response:
⛷️ **Stateline Canyon** — Near Teton Pass / WY–ID border

**Difficulty:** Advanced
**Why Locals Love It:**
- Excellent powder retention
- Close to Teton Pass lots
- Perfect for storm days
- Moderate slope angles with trees
- Popular with advanced locals

**Gear Needed:** Avalanche transceiver (required), Probe and shovel, Touring setup, Helmet and snow safety gear

**Safety Notes:**
- Tight terrain—limited maneuver room
- Low visibility during storms
- Watch for tree wells and rollover features
- Ride with experienced partner

**Location:** [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Stateline+Canyon+Teton+Pass+WY)

patterns: Where can I get avalanche forecasts?

What are the snow conditions?
Where do I check avalanche warnings?
response:
🧭 **Avalanche Forecasts & Snow Conditions**

**Forecast Centers:**
- [Bridger-Teton Avalanche Center](https://www.jhavalanche.org/)
- [Sawtooth Avalanche Center (Driggs access routes)](https://www.sawtoothavalanche.com/)

**Daily Reports:**
- [Bridger-Teton Avalanche Center Daily Bulletin](https://www.jhavalanche.org/viewTeton)
- [NOAA Jackson WY Zone Forecast](https://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?textField1=43.4791&textField2=-110.7624)

patterns: What’s the emergency number in Teton backcountry?
Who do I call if someone gets hurt?
Is there rescue near Jackson skiing?
Sheriff contact for Teton Pass?
response:
🚨 **Emergency Contacts for Jackson/Alpine/Driggs Backcountry**

- **Teton County Search & Rescue**: 911 (dispatch) or (307) 733-2331
  _Always call 911 in an emergency. Inform them you are in the backcountry._
- **Teton County Sheriff (non-emergency)**: (307) 733-4052
- **Lincoln County Sheriff – Alpine region**: (307) 885-5231

🎿 **Backcountry Gear Rentals** — Jackson, Driggs, Alpine

**Teton Mountaineering** (Jackson, WY)
- Gear: Avalanche transceivers, Probes, Shovels, Backcountry skis/splitboards, Climbing skins, Crampons and ice axes

**Skinny Skis** (Jackson, WY)
- Gear: Avalanche gear (limited), Nordic touring gear, Winter outerwear, Backcountry accessories
- [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Skinny+Skis+Jackson+WY) | [Website](https://skinnyskis.com/)

**Hoback Sports** (Jackson, WY)
- Gear: Backcountry skis and boards, Transceivers, shovels, and probes, Boot fitting and custom liners, Helmets and poles
- [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Hoback+Sports+Jackson+WY) | [Website](https://hobacksports.com/)

**Peaked Sports** (Driggs, ID)
- Gear: Skis and splitboards, Avalanche gear, Touring boots and skins, Winter clothing
- [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?q=Peaked+Sports+Driggs+ID) | [Website](https://www.peakedsports.com/)

**Alpine Adventure Rentals** (Alpine, WY)
